node.title: What does living with COVID look like? Europe's bleak winter is the world's worst case scenario
node.alt: A woman in a face mask looks out the window of a red double decker bus at Christmas lights
node.description: The days in the northern hemisphere are growing short and cold, allowing the Delta variant to take hold as people retreat indoors, while vaccine immunity wanes and inoculation rates stagnate. Â
node.content:
["Across the European continent, the festive cheer has set in.", "Christmas markets are opening, mulled wine is being warmed and festive lights adorn the streets. \u00a0\u00a0", "But with less than six weeks until Christmas Day, there are concerns the COVID-19 situation could grow far worse and shut down another year of holiday celebrations.\u00a0", "On Thursday, Germany reported\u00a0over 65,000 new coronavirus infections \u2014 a new daily record and a third higher than a week previously \u2014\u00a0and 264 new deaths.", "To the south, neighbouring Austria has one of the highest infection rates on the continent and more than a third of its population unvaccinated.\u00a0", "Elsewhere in Europe, Slovakia and the Czech Republic have reported daily records in the number of new cases while Hungary and Poland have reported their highest numbers in six months.", "", "
Weeks out from Christmas, the UK's Prime Minister has warned that \"storm clouds are gathering over the continent\".\u00a0(Reuters:\u00a0Henry Nicholls)
", "Last winter, Europe was in the throes of a\u00a0major outbreak fuelled by the Alpha variant.\u00a0", "But this time, temperatures are dropping and people are huddling indoors in the age of Delta.\u00a0", "It will be the world's first experience of living with the highly infectious strain in the perfect conditions for it to spread.\u00a0", "So how did Europe come back to the brink of a new wave of the pandemic?\u00a0", "
'We are all so tired'\u00a0
", "Higher-income countries in western Europe have \"lost their advantage\" in the fight against COVID-19, said Dr Christian Karagiannidis, the President of the German Society of Intensive Care Medicine.\u00a0", "He is a\u00a0critical care doctor at the Cologne-Merheim Hospital in Germany's east.\u00a0", "\"We all are so tired \u2026 and now the hospital beds are all full again,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"It's now more than one-and-a-half years with the pandemic, we lost many nurses [who quit].", "\"And the numbers are increasing from day to day, and there is no stop mechanism.\"", "At the beginning of the year, Dr Karagiannidis was feeling optimistic about his country's prospect of tackling the virus \u2014 Germany was a central production hub for the Pfizer vaccine and the national rollout began with gusto.", "But immunisation rates stalled in recent months and now sit at around 68 per cent.", "", "
Exhausted health workers in Europe are facing another potential wave of serious COVID-19 infections.\u00a0(Reuters:\u00a0Giorgos Moutafis)
", "Outgoing German Chancellor Angela Merkel described the situation as \"dramatic\" and pleaded for unvaccinated citizens to consider getting their first dose.", "Doctors witnessing the new wave unfold in countries including Austria, Switzerland, the Netherlands and Belgium\u00a0claim governments have been too slow to deploy booster shots. \u00a0\u00a0", "They believe the dangerous mix of factors unfolding in Europe could happen in any country. \u00a0", "
The three 'unfortunate' factors that collided \u00a0\u00a0
", "The days in the northern hemisphere are growing short and cold, allowing the Delta variant to take hold as people retreat indoors, while vaccine immunity wanes and inoculation rates stagnate. \u00a0", "These factors have \"met at such an unfortunate time,\" said Dr Eva Schernhammer\u00a0from the Medical University of Vienna. \u00a0", "\"The summer was fine, low case numbers, everything without restriction, but then in the [autumn]\u00a0the numbers kept creeping up among the unvaccinated, almost exclusively,\" she said.", "Austria has one of the lowest vaccination rates in western Europe.", "Austria is the first European country to counteract rising cases by imposing a lockdown on the unvaccinated.", "", "
Austrian police\u00a0officers check the vaccination status of shoppers in Vienna.(Reuters:\u00a0Lisi Niesner)
", "Police have been patrolling the streets checking citizens' vaccine passports and questioning if the unvaccinated are out only for essential reasons like work or food shopping.", "The move prompted a warning from the World Health Organization, who said such tough restrictions \"raise\u00a0real issues around human rights\".", "Germany also looks set to tighten the freedoms on unvaccinated people in the coming days, requiring them to show proof of a negative test to catch public transport or enter many indoor venues. \u00a0\u00a0", "But \"it is not enough on its own\" to stop the spread and save the holiday season, Dr Schernhammer said. \u00a0\u00a0", "\"Doing\u00a0some lockdown measures, trying to get the numbers down, opening up \u2026 [cases]\u00a0will go up again if you don't have enough people vaccinated in the population,\" she said. \u00a0\u00a0", "\"I think this will alert other countries to the fact that they should rather sooner than later get their own citizens their booster shot.\" \u00a0", "Already the growing cases and new restrictions have motivated tens of thousands to turn out for both boosters and their first dose, official data from Germany and Austria shows. \u00a0", "And on Thursday\u00a0Germany's vaccine advisory committee recommended booster shots for all people over the age of 18.", "Fears COVID-19 could cancel another Christmas\u00a0\u00a0", "While high-income countries like Germany, Austria and Switzerland are yet to hit a 70 per cent vaccination rate, it is even worse\u00a0in parts of eastern Europe. \u00a0\u00a0", "Already Romania's hospitals are so full, patients are being sent away to be treated by hospitals in other countries, which Mr Karagiannidis said would impact the whole continent. \u00a0", "", "
Romania's 2,000 intensive care beds are all full, and patients are now having to wait outside or be transferred to other countries for treatment.\u00a0(AP:\u00a0Vadim Ghirda)
", "British Prime Minister Boris Johnson this week warned \"a new wave\" of cases was coming, with \"storm clouds are gathering over the continent\".", "About 80 per cent of residents in the UK are double-vaccinated, but the rollout of booster shots has been slow with only about a quarter of eligible people receiving their third dose. \u00a0", "Cases have been stubbornly high, averaging about 40,000 a day, and the UK government is pinning its hopes on expanding the booster program to save Christmas.", "\"During Christmas, we will have for sure a high number of COVID-19 patients in the ICU,\" said Dr Karagiannidis \u00a0", "\"We all want to have a free Christmas, we need to invest a lot now and not in one, two or three or four weeks.\u00a0", "\"One part is booster shots and the second part is \u2026 convincing more to get vaccinated.\"", "The British Government is taking a more conservative approach to booster shots, and while daily case numbers remain high, deaths and hospitalisations are slowly falling, and the UK is currently only advising a third jab to those over the age of 40.", "Prime Minister Johnson told UK citizens the \"most important thing people can do\" to save Christmas was to get boosters or consider getting their first vaccination.", "\"We don't yet know the extent to which this new wave will wash up on our shores,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"But history shows we cannot afford to be complacent.\"\u00a0", "", "
Some European\u00a0experts fear Christmas will occur under restrictions for a second year as cases grow.\u00a0(Reuters:\u00a0Fabrizio Bensch)
"]
